main event: A black colored object was observed at approximately 1,000 feet altitude in Beloit, Wisconsin on 2 March 1956.
interesting points: The object was stationary at first before gaining altitude and disappearing., The exact size of the object was unknown., The sighting lasted for about thirty minutes., There were multiple hypotheses about the object's nature, including being a balloon or weather phenomena., The document indicates that the sighting may not have been detected on radar.
witness description: no witnesses reported in the document
